Classifier: Random Forest
-------------------------

Model parameters were fine-tuned using `RandomizedSearchCV`.

The best parameters were found to be:
{'n_estimators': 800, 'min_samples_split': 202, 'min_samples_leaf': 131, 'min_impurity_decrease': 0.0, 'max_leaf_nodes': 160, 'max_features': 1, 'max_depth': 211, 'criterion': 'gini', 'class_weight': None}

I used the precision as the score, and got the best score of 0.9501607643968274.

Applied a standard scaler to the following x-variables:
['rec.energy.numu.lstmmuon']

I have used a balanced class dataset (meaning that the number of events for each class is the same!), but like an idiot I also applied this balance class transformation on my testing data which defeats the whole point! SO I DID REANALYSED MY DATA AND FOUND THIS:
